name: Five Total Strangers
description: When Mira flies home to spend Christmas with her mother in Pittsburgh, a record-breaking blizzard results in a cancelled layover. Desperate to get to her grief-ridden mother in the wake of a family death, Mira hitches a ride with a group of friendly college kids who were on her initial flight.
As the drive progresses and weather conditions become more treacherous, Mira realizes that the four other passengers she's stuck in the car with don't actually know one another.
Soon, they're not just dealing with heavy snowfall and ice-slick roads, but the fact that somebody will stop at nothing to ensure their trip ends in a deadly disaster.
review: "Five total Strangers" is a very good gripping mystery novel that will keep the reader busy throught. I picked this book randomly but it was a unearthed gem. The story follows our Protagonist Mira, a teenage girl who finds herself trapped in a blizzard with 4 strangers in a remote roadside diner. As the storm intensifies, the tension rises among the group which makes mira increasingly suspicious of her fellow travelers. When a series of mysterious and alarming events occur, it becomes clear that there is something more to the situation than it meets the eye. Mira has to unravel the secrets and motives while trying to survive the deadly storm.

The plot is filled with twists, turns and unexpected revelations. Natalie D.Richards masterfully builds suspense, keeping the readers guessing and second guessing the true nature of each character's intentions. The sense of unease and the atmosphere of clautrophobis within the travelers heighten the suspense and add to the overall tension of the story.

If we have to talk about the characters, I would say they are well-developed and complex, each with their own motivations and hidden agendas. Mira, the protagonist is a relatable and strong willed character who drives the narrative forward with her determination to uncover the truth. The interaction between the strangers are fraught with suspicion and mistrust, adding depth to the story and making to difficult to figure who can be trusted.

The mystery side of the book is skillfully created with clues scattered throughout. Richards expertly paces the revelations while building suspense and gracefully peeling the layers of mystery. The reader is definitely kept engaged and invested, eagerly trying to piece together the puzzle alongside Mira.

The writing style in "Five Total Strangers" is fast-paced and engrossing, with vivid descriptions that bring the chilling setting and intense emotions to life. The author explores themes like trust, deception and survival, delving into human nature's complexity when faced with life or death situation.In conclusion, this book is a thrilling and suspenseful mystery that will keep readers captivated until the very last page. With its tightly plotted storyline, intriguing characters, and atmospheric setting, the book delivers an exhilarating reading experience. This is a must read  Whoever likes suspenseful and twisty mysteries

name: The 7 1/2 Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle
description: Aiden Bishop knows the rules. Evelyn Hardcastle will die every day until he can identify her killer and break the cycle. But every time the day begins again, Aiden wakes up in the body of a different guest at Blackheath Manor. And some of his hosts are more helpful than others. With a locked room mystery that Agatha Christie would envy, Stuart Turton unfurls a breakneck novel of intrigue and suspense.

For fans of Claire North, and Kate Atkinson, The 7½ Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle is a breathlessly addictive mystery that follows one man's race against time to find a killer, with an astonishing time-turning twist that means nothing and no one are quite what they seem.
review: "The 7 1/2 Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle" by Stuart Turton is a captivating and creative mystery novel that delivers an immersive and mind-bending experience. I picked up this book thinking that it was Sci Fi theme but what I found was much more intriguing. The story unfolds within the confines of an isolated mansion, where guests have gathered for a masquerade ball. However, a perplexing and complex mystery awaits them.

So the main thing is that the protagonist, Aiden Bishop, wakes up each day in the body of a different guest, reliving the same day repeatedly. He is tasked with solving the murder of Evelyn Hardcastle, but the challenge is heightened by the intricate and convoluted nature of the plot. Aiden must navigate the web of secrets, deceit, and unexpected alliances among the guests in order to unravel the truth behind the murder.

Regarding the plot, Turton expertly weaves together multiple timelines and perspectives, gradually unraveling the layers of the mystery. Each day brings new revelations, surprises, and unexpected twists that continually reshape the narrative, keeping the reader on the edge of their seat.

The characters in the novel are richly developed and compelling. Each guest at the mansion has their own motivations, secrets, and connection to the murder, making for a complex and fascinating story. As Aiden's perspective shifts between different characters, it provides unique insights into their personalities and driving the story forward. The mystery itself is a brilliantly crafted puzzle, with clues and hints scattered throughout the narrative. The author challenges the reader to piece together the puzzle alongside Aiden, unraveling the truth about Evelyn's death and the hidden dynamics at play. The sense of urgency and the mounting tension create an atmosphere of suspense that propels the story forward.

The author's writing style is atmospheric and evocative, immersing the reader in the haunting and claustrophobic setting of the mansion. Turton skillfully balances the intricate plot with moments of introspection and emotional depth, creating a multi-layered reading experience that engages both the intellect and the heart.

In conclusion, "The 7 1/2 Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle" is an extraordinary and captivating mystery novel that will leave readers spellbound. I would also say it also has elements of fantasy within it. With its complex plot, clever twists, and well-drawn characters, it offers a suspenseful and thrilling journey into a world of secrets and intrigue.This book a must-read for fans of mystery and suspense.

name: Project Hail Mary
description: Ryland Grace is the sole survivor on a desperate, last-chance mission—and if he fails, humanity and Earth itself will perish.
Except that right now, he doesn't know that. He can't even remember his own name, let alone the nature of his assignment or how to complete it.
All he knows is that he's been asleep for a very, very long time. And he's just been awakened to find himself millions of miles from home, with nothing but two corpses for company.....
review: "Project Hail Mary" by Andy Weir is an exhilarating science fiction novel that takes readers on an interstellar journey filled with mystery, suspense, and high-stakes adventure and it was also the first Sci Fi book i tried reading. The story follows Ryland Grace, a brilliant scientist who wakes up on a spacecraft with no memory of who he is or how he got there.

As the narrative unfolds,  our protagonist discovers that he is on a desperate mission to save humanity from an impending cosmic threat. Alongside him are two deceased astronauts who provide crucial information and guidance. Together, they must unravel the mystery behind the threat and find a way to save Earth.

Weir's storytelling is captivating, with a perfect balance of scientific accuracy and thrilling plot twists. The novel seamlessly combines elements of space exploration, alien encounters, and survival against overwhelming odds. Through flashbacks and Grace's gradual recollection of his past, the layers of the story unfold, revealing a compelling and intricately woven narrative.

The characters in this novel are well-developed and relatable, each with their unique personalities and motivations. Ryland Grace, in particular, is a compelling protagonist who showcases intelligence, resilience, and a touch of humor. His journey of self-discovery and the emotional connections he forms along the way add depth and heart to the story.

The scientific concepts and problem-solving aspects in the book are both fascinating and accessible. Weir's attention to detail and meticulous research shine through, making the story feel grounded and believable, even in its speculative elements. The blend of scientific exploration and personal growth creates a mystery like feeling that keeps readers engaged and invested.

The pacing of the novel is superb, with a careful balance of intense action sequences and quieter moments of reflection. Weir keeps the suspense high, consistently raising the stakes and introducing unexpected twists that will keep readers on edge.

Without giving away too much, this book is a thrilling ride that explores themes of sacrifice, resilience, and the indomitable spirit of humanity. It is a proof to human ingenuity and the power of collaboration in the face of seemingly insurmountable challenges.

In conclusion, "Project Hail Mary" is a must-read for fans of science fiction and mystery. Andy Weir's masterful blend of scientific accuracy, suspenseful plot, and relatable characters creates an immersive reading experience that will leave readers both satisfied and in awe of the wonders of the cosmos.

name: And Then There were None
description: The 10 strangers include a reckless playboy, a troubled Harley Street doctor, a formidable judge, an uncouth detective, an unscrupulous mercenary, a God-fearing spinster, two restless servants, a highly decorated general and an anxious secretary. One by one they are picked off. Who will survive? And who is the killer? Copies of an ominous nursery rhyme hang in each room, the murders mimicking the awful fates of its ‘Ten Little Soldier Boys'.
review: "And Then There Were None" by Agatha Christie is a classic mystery novel that follows ten strangers who are lured to an isolated island off the coast of Devon. The guests are seemingly unrelated and have been brought together by a mysterious invitation from an unknown host. Upon arrival, the guests discover that their host is not present and are left wondering what the true purpose of their visit is.

As the night wears on, the guests are mysteriously picked off one by one, with each murder becoming more and more gruesome. The remaining guests begin to suspect each other. Their fear and paranoia grow, the guests become desperate to uncover the truth and escape the island alive.

The characters in the novel are all unique and interesting, each with their own secrets and motivations. As the guests are picked off one by one, the reader is left wondering who will be next and who is responsible for the murders. The setting of the isolated island only adds to the feeling of isolation and desperation, as the characters are trapped with nowhere to run.

The mystery at the heart of the novel is masterfully crafted, with twists and turns, clues and red herrings that keep the reader in suspense. Author's attention to detail is impressive, and everything in the novel has a purpose and a place in the larger puzzle. The pacing of the novel is perfect, with each chapter building on the tension and suspense of the previous one. The final reveal is both surprising and satisfying, tying together all the loose ends and leaving the reader with a sense of closure.

Overall, "And Then There Were None" is a very good mystery novel that will keep readers on the edge of their seats until the final page. The writing is interesting, the characters are engaging, and the plot is brilliantly executed. Highly recommended for anyone who loves a good mystery or suspenseful thriller

name: Anxious People
description: In a small town in Sweden, it appears to be an ordinary day. But look more closely, and you'll see a mysterious masked figure approaching a bank . . .
Two hours later, chaos has descended.
A bungled attempted robbery has developed into a hostage situation - and the offender is refusing to communicate their demands to the police.
Inside the building, fear quickly turns to irritation for the seven strangers trapped inside. If this is to be their last day on earth, shouldn't it be a bit more dramatic?
review: I can say "Anxious People" is a delightful novel that tells the story of a group of strangers who find themselves trapped together during a failed bank robbery. The book is an excellent exploration of human relationships and the power of empathy.

The story is told in a bit of non linear fashion and each chapter gives insight into the characters and the relationship they have with each other. The plot is written around a failed bank robbery which ends up in an apartment with a group of strangers. As the story unfolds, we get to know about characters backstory which creates a great narrative that is both heartwarming and inspiring.

The author does an excellent job of illustrating how the characters band together and develop unanticipated bonds in the face of difficulty. The way the characters interact with one another and reveal their innermost thoughts and feelings is captivating and adds depth to the story. The writing style is engaging and witty, with a funny tone that keeps the reader entertained throughout the book.

The pacing is excellent, with the story moving seamlessly between different perspectives and timelines. The book is a page-turner, with each chapter ending on a kind off cliffhanger that leaves the reader eager to find out what's gonna happen next. Even thought the theme of the book is like anxiety, depression, the author has managed to infuse the story with a sense of humour and hope.

In conclusion, The story is engaging, the writing is witty, and the characters are relatable and memorable. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a new perspective on the theme of the book.

name: Gone Girl
description: Marriage can be a real killer.

On a warm summer morning in North Carthage, Missouri, it is Nick and Amy Dunne's fifth wedding anniversary. Presents are being wrapped and reservations are being made when Nick's clever and beautiful wife disappears from their rented McMansion on the Mississippi River. Husband-of-the-Year Nick isn't doing himself any favors with cringe-worthy daydreams about the slope and shape of his wife's head, but passages from Amy's diary reveal the alpha-girl perfectionist could have put anyone dangerously on edge....
review: "Gone Girl" by Gillian Flynn is a thrilling novel that explores the dark side of relationships and the art of manipulation. The book tells the story of a married couple, Nick and Amy Dunne, and their crumbling marriage.

The themes of trust, deception, and manipulation are central to the story, and the author did an excellent job in keeping the readers guessing what actually happened and one thing for sure is that you will be completely immersed in the story.

The book is split into three parts, each one building on the previous to create a gripping and suspenseful story. The first part introduces Nick and Amy's relationship and provides a glimpse into their past. The second part takes a deep dive into their troubled marriage. The third part is a thrilling roller coaster regarding the climax.

One of the most interesting aspects of the book is the way it portrays the dynamics of a toxic relationship. The power struggle between the primary characters is evident, and their ability to manipulate one another is both fascinating and unsettling. The characters are well-developed, and their motivations and actions are believable, adding to the story's suspense. It's a cautionary tale that shows just how easily a relationship can go south.

The book's twisty conclusion neatly wraps up all the loose ends while still leaving some things up for interpretation. I won't reveal anything, but fair enough to say that you'll be both surprised and pleased.

Overall, "Gone Girl" is a must-read for fans of psychological suspense novels and anybody eager to delve deeper into complexities of relationships. The book is an excellent exploration of the darker side of human nature and the lengths people will go to get what they want.

name: One of us is Lying
description: On Monday afternoon, five students at Bayview High walk into detention. Bronwyn, the brain, is Yale-bound and never breaks a rule. Addy, the beauty, is the picture-perfect homecoming princess. Nate, the criminal, is already on probation for dealing. Cooper, the athlete, is the all-star baseball pitcher. And Simon, the outcast, is the creator of Bayview High's notorious gossip app.
Everyone has secrets, right? What really matters is how far you would go to protect them.
review: I will consider "One of Us is Lying" as a neatly written story that will keep you guessing until the end. The book is set in a high school and revolves around 5 students who are sent to detention, but only four come out alive. The best part of the book which I liked most was how the story was told from different perspectives of the characters. As one continues, every chapter unravels a vital peice of information, bringing one closer to the mystery of the fifth dead student.

If I have to talk about the characters, they are pretty well developed as they all have their own unique backstory and secrets. The protagonist, Bronwyn, is a smart and ambitious student. Nate, the second protagonist, is a charming and charismatic character who is hiding a dark secret. The other characters, Cooper, Addy, and Simon, are also well-crafted and have their own personalities and motivations. The author has done an excellent job of creating suspense and increasing the tension as the plot is full of twists and turns which will keep the reader hooked.

The thing I liked a bit more about this book is that how it explores the concept of secrets and how it can affect people. For instance few secrets more important than the actual truth or what is the nature of the truth or how those secrets might affect relationships.

The writing is well-done, the way it is written and described, really appealed to me and the best part about the writing is definitely the perspectives part which I have already mentioned in the previous paragraph, the writing keeps on changing to different character's perspective which gives a whole different experience. The details are another thing which adds a bit more reality to the whole story. The plot is full of twists and turns that will keep you guessing until the very end. The ending is also satisfying and ties up all the loose ends.
I would recommend "One of Us is Lying" to anyone who enjoys a good mystery novel. If you like books like Hunger Games or The Maze Runner then you might enjoy this one too.

Overall, I would say this book is a fast-paced and highly engaging novel that will keep you in suspense all the way. It's a great read for anyone who loves some mystery, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new read.

She's fighting for her life in more ways than one: if and when she recovers, she'll be taken back to Stockholm to stand trial for three murders. With the help of her friend, journalist Mikael Blomkvist, she will not only have to prove her innocence, but also identify and denounce those in authority who have allowed the vulnerable, like herself, to suffer abuse and violence. And, on her own, she will plot revenge - against the man who tried to kill her, and the corrupt government institutions that very nearly destroyed her life.

The NSA is being held hostage... not by guns or bombs, but by a code so ingeniously complex that if released it would cripple U.S. intelligence.
